page.title: 15Iden Park,Staplehurst.
page.content: Sir Harry and Lady Mary Hoare lived in the old manor but Lady Mary became very ill and Sir Harry decided that the manor was too low down and that it was the damp that collected in the area that made it so unhealthy so he built Iden Manor on the hill. Both Iden Manor and Old Manor are now used by the nuns of St.Mary's Convent. The old manor accommodates the elderly nuns some of whom are one hundred years old. The main work of St. Mary's Convent up to a few years ago was the care of disturbed girls but they now work with older women some of whom they help to overcome alcohol problems The nuns have recently sold Iden Lake and Lake House and put the money towards the church. The chapel at St. Mary's convent is used for worship by Staplehurst's Roman Catlolic community
